MAX_BYTES_PER_SIGNAL - Static variable in class main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.config.ProtocolConfig
The maximum possible number of bytes that a signal could consist of assuming it is ProtocolConfig.MAX_SIGNAL_LENGTH characters long Defined as ProtocolConfig.MAX_SIGNAL_LENGTH * ProtocolConfig.BYTES_PER_SIGNAL_CHARACTER
MAX_PORT - Static variable in class main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.config.TCPAcceptorConfig
 
MAX_POSSIBLE_SERIALIZED_MESSAGE_LENGTH - Static variable in class main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.config.ProtocolConfig
The maximum possible serialized message length is defined as the sum of the ProtocolConfig.MAX_SERIALIZED_SIGNAL_LENGTH + the ProtocolConfig.MAX_SERIALIZED_PAYLOAD_SIZE
MAX_SERIALIZED_PAYLOAD_SIZE - Static variable in class main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.config.ProtocolConfig
The maximum size of the payload that can be sent and received as denoted by the VRMeeting Messaging Protocol
MAX_SERIALIZED_SIGNAL_LENGTH - Static variable in class main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.config.ProtocolConfig
The maximum serialized signal length is defined as the ProtocolConfig.MAX_BYTES_PER_SIGNAL + The length of the ProtocolConfig.ENCODED_END_OF_SIGNAL_DELIMITER
MAX_SIGNAL_LENGTH - Static variable in class main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.config.ProtocolConfig
The maximum number of characters that can be used to define a 'signal' as defined by the VRMeeting Messaging Protocol
Meeting - Class in main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.meeting
Represents a collection of Users who can communicate between one another A meeting has an ID, a number of people present and 1 presenter Once started a meeting will execute events added to a queue by the connections present in the meeting clients

MEETING_ID_CHARACTER_SET_NAME - Static variable in class main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.config.ProtocolConfig
The name of the character set used to encode the Meeting ID of a MID message as defined by the VRMeeting Messaging Protocol

MockDataServer - Class in test.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.mock
A mock DataServerConnector used in testing Has the ability to change whether MockDataServer.retrieveUserData(String) throws an exception due to an invalid token and MockDataServer.retreiveMeetingData(String) throws an exception due to an invalid meeting id Also whether either will throw an exception due to the data server being 'unavailable' By default the server is available and all tokens and meetingid are valid A defualt test user is returned unless an alternative is provided in the constructor
